article.description: Dion sparks New Hampshire past Boston U 75-68
article.headline: Dion sparks New Hampshire past Boston U 75-68
article.linkText: Dion sparks New Hampshire past Boston U 75-68
article.story: DURHAM, N.H. -- Daniel Dion put together a late 12-point surge, finishing with 23 points off the bench and carrying New Hampshire past Boston University 75-68 on Tuesday night. The Wildcats (2-2) were nursing a late two-point lead when Dion took over, hitting a 3-pointer and a pair of free throws. After John Papale sank one from deep, Dion followed with a 3-point dagger to make it 71-64 with 37 seconds left. He sank two more free throws and a layup to seal it. New Hampshire outscored Boston 22-3 in points off turnovers and 28-18 in the paint. Jaleen Smith scored 15 points, Jacoby Armstrong added 13 and Tanner Leissner had 12 with seven rebounds. Cedric Hankerson hit four 3-pointers and was 10 of 11 from the free throw line, pacing the Terriers (1-3) with a career-high 26 points while grabbing 10 rebounds. Papale added 16 points and five assists for Boston.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
